author: Chris Borges
comment: Does exactly what I was looking for. Extremely handy to have, especially if you use multiple timers daily and it's a hassle to continuously interrupt what you're doing on your phone. 5 stars for the U.I. being clean and simple as well. Great work!
title: A smartwatch essential.

author: Tim Swast
comment: I live by this app. I use it multiple times a day. I set a 25 minute timer to remind me to look away from the screen for a few seconds. I swipe this one away and have no issue with it.  I set a second timer to move away from my desk every 50 minutes. I have this set to the walk dismissal. My problem is that the step detection is very unreliable. About a third to half the time I have to reboot my android wear watch because the timer just won't detect all the steps and dismiss. Perhaps a workaround could be to add a "no really, I have actually walked, trust me" dismissal option?

author: Benjamin Cox
comment: By far the best Android wear timer. It's great for people with disabilities who need very gentle but noticeable reminders and prompts. Very easy to set and use, though when I paid for the full version it didn't seem to unlock anything at all

author: Elijah Wyatt
comment: The app is good at what it does, but I wish the dev would add the ability to create and edit timers in the phone app, as well as change the default time picker to 00:00:00. If those features are added, I'll change my review to 5 stars.
title: Works great for me

author: Priidu Uusen
comment: Does the job, but I miss more functionality in the phone app, works with voice recognition but cant select the default vibration time. Also, the full screen feature of the stock timer is very nice but missing in this onr
Solid timer app! I would love to have a single vibration without the need to dismiss and an auto-snooze function in the future.

author: Caden Bloxham
comment: A phone UI needs to be developed to easily rename, reorder, add, edit, and generally manage alarms. Administration is very clunky with the watch-only interface. An option to adjust notification priority (card vs full-face), per alarm, would be a welcome addition as well. Otherwise, the app works as intended, and quite worth upgrading to premium.
title: A good start, but...

author: Jim T
comment: Doesn't trigger when screen is not on. I have to activate the screen at the exact moment the timer runs out to get the notification. Useless as a timer.
title: One job to to... And it fails.

author: Rick Michaelson
comment: Don't bother supporting the developer by paying for app. I sent an email with a question regarding vibrations and developer didn't bother to respond.
title: Ok app

author: Clifton Colburn
comment: Best Multi Timer in the Market
